chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court.  Attorney Brandon Carlson for Peter M Wolff in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter received from Atty. Wolff
Motion for Bail Modification

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court in custody and by Attorney Peter M. Wolff.  Not guilty plea entered.  Defendant has new charges pending with an initial appearance in Branch I later today.  Counsel requests 45-60 days.  State believes a 30 day adjournment is sufficient.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Bond amount amended from $20,000 to $10,000. No contact with B.C.H. unless approved by Child Protective Services (CPS) or Human Services Department.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court, in custody from WCJ.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Argument on defense motion to modify bond; State objects.  Court puts findings on the record and Court orders bond reduced to $10,000 cash and conditions shall remain the same as previously set.   Attorney Wolff requests 22CF105 and 22CF106 be rescheduled to 3:00 PM on September 15th and the Judicial Assistant shall follow up regarding same.

Arraignment on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in custody and by Attorney Gillion Parham.  WITNESS:  Officer Christopher Brook (WBPD).  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Atty. Parham requests to be heard on bond.  Argument by counsel.  State opposes.  Court denies any bond modification.

No contact with BCH unless approved by Child Protection Services and or Human Services Dept [Copies mailed to DA (electronic), Def (mail), & Jail (mail)]

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Attorney Edgar A. Beltran via video.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Argument on bond.  State requests $20,000 cash bond.  Recess.  Atty. Beltran/defendant placed in Zoom breakout room.  Case recalled.  $20,000 cash bond set.
